contents.item: If you're going to lead people, you've got to have somewhere to go.

Leadership is detachment: detachment from material goods, detachment from feelings as well as personal detachment. To lead is to get rid of the filters of the mind and the addictions of the heart, is to see through the fog not only the objectives clearly but also the way to pursue them.
Leadership needs continuous learning from experience. Every time you learn something new, you re-wire your brain.

contents.item: Leaders don't rise to the pinnacle of success without developing the right set of attitudes and habits: They make every day a masterpiece. They are also humble enough to realize their victories depend upon their people

Attitude is the power of leadership. Nothing can stop a person from achieving success who has the right attitude. Our attitude cannot stop our feelings, but they can prevent our feelings from stopping us
Leaders think and talk about the solutions and progress Followers think and talk about the problems and negative criticism
A potential leader who obeys God is in much better position to succeed than one who ignores God's will for his life
Leadership is not about about having power over people - it is about empowering people ans showing them direction
Your potential is not a trial and error experience. God designed and predetermined you to be a success story.
Work hard. Work smart. Remain grounded. Serve others and be enthusiastic.
If you want success as a leader in a complex environment read Commanding Excellence and follow it!

contents.item: No institution can possibly survive if it needs geniuses or supermen to manage it. It must be organized in such a way as to be able to get along under a leadership composed of average human beings.
No one can be managed or led, people are inspired and cared for.
Building a better world requires re-humanising the whole world .It is the only practical way.
Live. Love. Learn. Lead.
Leadership is about what’s right for the organization, not what feels right for the leader.
